docs.title: 🖥️ Présentation
docs.text:
Bienvenue chez la team SI-SIG !

Ce dépôt GitHub a été mis en place pour permettre la collaboration entre nos différentes équipes, partager, échanger et mettre à disposition du code, de la documentation, des guides autour du SI et du SIG.

docs.title: 🖥️ Dépôts de la team
docs.text: • Le dépôt GitHub du CEN Nouvelle-Aquitaine

docs.title: 💬 Venez échanger
docs.text: • Notre 😺 IRC

docs.title: SUMMARY
docs.text:
• Accueil
  • Comment contribuer ?
  • Tutoriels
  • HistoricalMap
    • Home
    • Filtering
    • Training
    • Classification
  • *.md

docs.title: Comment contribuer ?
docs.text:
1. Syntaxe de base pour l’écriture et la mise en forme
  2. Éditer ou créer un nouveau fichier *.md
  3. Modifier le sommaire SUMMARY.md si besoin

docs.title: What do you need ?
docs.text:
• Your filtered image (got at step 1)
  • Your model (got at step 2)

docs.title: Class number :
docs.text: It’s the class you want to get the polygons for classification. Our method use a binary step, so today you will only get the classification for an unique class (forest for example). If you want the polygon result for another class you will need to do the step 3 again.

docs.title: Min parcel size :
docs.text: If you consider your polygons must have a minimum size, you can set it here. For example for the forest, you usually consider that they have to be more than 0,5 hectare, so we set it by default at 0,5. How we calculate it ? We simply divided the default system measure by 100. In out training set our SRID is Lambert III (EPSG 2154) so it is in meters. So 0,5 means 0,5 hectares.

docs.title: What do you get ?
docs.text: You get polygons only from the selected class.

docs.title: Input image
docs.text: The image must be a geotiff (.tif, .tiff).

docs.title: Closing filter
docs.text:
Closing filter performs a max then a min filter. Here you can see the differences depending on the window size :

Original Size 5 Size 11

docs.title: Median filter
docs.text:
Median filter is used to remove noise and it perserves edges.Here you can see the differences after using the closing filter with the same window size as the median filter :

Original Size 5 Size 11

docs.title: Median filter iteration
docs.text:
Median filter iteration : you can specify how many times you want the script to perform the median filter. For exempla you may want the script to do 5 times the median filter to remove more noise. Here are an example :

1 iteration 5 iterations

docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Welcome to the HistoricalMap wiki!

You have three steps, the filtering, the training and the classifying.

All you need to have is :

  • tif file
  • A shape file with your training cells

docs.title: 1.Learn how to filter
docs.text: Here you will find some tips to understand our different filters (closing and median).

docs.title: What do you need for the training ?
docs.text:
You just need two things :

  • The filtered image got from the previous step
  • The training shapefile : You need to have a column (by default we call it ‘Class’) where you put the ID (and not the name) of your classification (1 for forest, 2 for water…). For example, if you have the forest to classify, you can draw some polygons of your forest, some polygons and fields, some of waters… Think to use the same projection as your filtered image.

docs.title: Can you explain what are classifiers, seed, split… ?
docs.text: Of course ! All these parameters are adjustable and you can set them.

docs.title: Classifiers
docs.text:
Let’s begin with the classifiers. First, GMM,KNN,RF, or SVM are acronyms, but also algorithms. These are different ways to learn and to guess in what class will be classified the pixel.

If you don’t have scikit-learn installed on your computer (aka sklearn, it’s a library), you can only use GMM.

  • GMM : Gaussian Mixture Model
  • KNN : K-Nearest Neighbors
  • RF : Random-Forest
  • SVM : Support Vector Machine

docs.title: Split
docs.text: Split is the amount of parcel used for the training. If you choose 0,5 it means and 50% of the parcel is used for training and 50% for the confusion matrix. If split if 1 you won’t have a confusion matrix.

docs.title: Seed
docs.text: The seed is used to compare the same parcel each time, so you can put the number you want in it and use it the next time if you want to compare the data.

  2. Pour réaliser des animations efficacement : https://www.screentogif.com/ ()

docs.text: • Cette méthode permet d’afficher les données sous la plupart des GPS, le champ renommé en name permet d’affecter un attribut comme nom du point dans le GPS.
